question.body: Why is hydrolysis an important part of the digestion processes?

multiple_choice.choice: It creates the cellular energy needed to fuel digestion.
It builds enzymes that help with digestion.
It always requires enzymes to build new molecules.
It breaks macromolecules down so they can be absorbed.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Although hydrolysis will release some energy during digestion, cellular energy is produced inside individual cells.
Incorrect. Hydrolysis may be catalyzed by enzymes, but it does not build them.
Incorrect. Hydrolysis is involved in the breaking of chemical bonds and can happen spontaneously.
Correct. Hydrolysis is the process that breaks macromolecules into smaller parts that can be absorbed by the small intestine.
